title: Shaco's "Q" + IE
body: Was curious from reading shaco's "Q", it scales with each skill.  My question is if your "Q" crits, it doesn't do 200% crit damage, it goes by what rank your "Q" is at?  Also, since i usually lvl up shiv first, my "Q" may be the last skill i rank up.  If i have an IE and my Q is rank 1, does it still only do 150% according to his "Q"s rank1?

replies.body: The way Shaco's Q works is that it changes your base crit multiplier. The base multipler is the standard 200%. IE adds 50% to your base, it doesn't actually change the base despite what it says. This means if your Q is at rank 1, your crit damage is set to 140% instead of 200%. With an IE, it's only 190%, which isn't very much at all, but when maxed, it'll be 220% plus the 50% from IE, which is 270%. Shaco's Q with IE has been confusing for many players considering Infinity Edge's poor wording.

So If i have "Q" at rank 1 with IE and i Q in and crit an enemy instead of just straight auto attacking, am i doing less damage?

What does more damage Rank 1 "Q" with IE crit
or
Regular AA crit with IE

Just treat IE's passive as something that adds 50% critical hit damage.

Rank 1 Q deals 140% crit damage. Add IE's bonus and you have 190%. This is lower than the base crit multiplier at 200%.

A rank 1 Q with IE crit deals less damage than regular AA crit with IE.
AW thank you.  That's what i thought.  Must be a balancing issue Thank you for confirming.
Don't start with Shiv. Start w/ boxes and stack them under the buff before it spawns.
I do start with boxes, i should have said Max instead of lvl. Thanks for the reply.
I'm guessing that the way it's coded accounts for it, but the tooltip for IE is poorly worded.
